description: Pityriasis Rosea is a common skin condition characterized by a rash that usually starts with a single, large pink or red patch on the chest, abdomen, or back, followed by smaller patches that spread out in a 'Christmas tree' pattern.
possible causes: The exact cause of Pityriasis Rosea is unknown, but it is believed to be related to viral infections, particularly the herpes virus.
symptoms: Single large patch followed by smaller patches
treatments: Pityriasis Rosea typically resolves on its own within a few weeks to months without treatment.
Over-the-counter antihistamines or corticosteroid creams may help with itching.
